thread.title: Tunisia: PM Pledges Budget Reforms in 2016
thread.title_full: Tunisia: PM Pledges Budget Reforms in 2016

title: Tunisia: PM Pledges Budget Reforms in 2016
text:
Tunisia: Supplementary Finance Bill 2015 Does Not Meet People's Aspirations (MPs) 
"The deterioration of the state of affairs in Libya also took its toll on trade," he underscored. 
In another connection, Essid said reforms in social funds will help avoid 2.6 billion dinars in losses over the next five years. 
The Government "shouldered its responsibility in protecting the tourism sector which is going through difficult times by means of granting aid and rescheduling sums due to the national electricity and water utilities," Essid indicated. Loans made were not cancelled but earnings from interest rates were postponed, he said. 
On projects on hold, Essid said his government made its utmost to smooth out obstacles, notably as regards highway projects which resumed in their majority. 
He also shed light on a number of large-scale projects in the governorates of Siliana, Kairouan and El Kef as part of the drinking water supply plan in northern Tunisia. 
The Prime Minister told deputies development budget cuts do not mean projects were abandoned but merely rescheduled. Tunisia
